articles.title: Greetings to Ugandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Ugandan President
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda, on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Uganda would grow stronger in the common interests and wished him success in the work for the prosperity of the country and the people's well-being.

articles.title: Greetings to FM of Gabon
articles.content:
Greetings to FM of Gabon
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Pacome Moubelet Boubeya upon his appointment as minister of State and minister of Foreign Affairs, Francophone, Regional Integration and Overseas Compatriots of Gabon. 
					 The message expressed the will to actively cooperate in opening a new phase for developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, wishing him success in his job.

articles.title: S. African President Wishes Korean People Success in Building Rich and Powerful Country
articles.content:
S. African President Wishes Korean People Success in Building Rich and Powerful Country
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador Kim Chang Ryop presented his credentials to Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma, president of the Republic of South Africa, on Oct. 4.
					 At the meeting the president wished the Korean people bigger success in their struggle for building a rich and powerful country under the guidance of supreme leader HE Kim Jong Un, , extending thanks to the DPRK government and people for always sending support and solidarity to the cause of the government and people of South Africa.

articles.title: General Secretary of Workers' Party of DR Congo Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
General Secretary of Workers' Party of DR Congo Visits DPRK Embassy
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Jimmy Kikoni, general secretary of the Workers' Party of DR Congo visited the DPRK Embassy in Kinshasa on October 3 on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 71st founding anniversary of the WPK.
					 He laid a bouquet before a painting depicting President Kim Il Sung standing together with Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Paying the highest tribute to Kim Il Sung, the founder of the WPK, and Kim Jong Il, the eternal leader of the WPK, he said:
					
					 I once again congratulate respected HE Kim Jong Un on his election as chairman of the WPK.
					
					 His election as chairman of the WPK at its 7th Congress marked a decisive landmark in strengthening the WPK and greatly encouraged the world progressive political parties in their struggle for accomplishing the cause of socialism and the cause of global independence.
					
					 Through the Seventh Congress of the WPK the DPRK demonstrated once again its unshakable will to hasten under the leadership of HE Kim Jong Un the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche to which the great leaders dedicated their whole lives. 
					
					 The Workers' Party of DR Congo extends invariable support and solidarity to the WPK in its struggle for implementing the important tasks set forth by the Party congress.

articles.title: Ugandan Delegation Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Ugandan Delegation Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- A Ugandan delegation for the study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism headed by Odauk Paul Michael, deputy commissioner of the National Secretariat for Patriotism Clubs Office of the President, Sunday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 The guests paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues in the palace.
					
					 They paid homage to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The head of the delegation made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Jong Il Sim, widow of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, and the Switzerland-Korea Committee sent floral baskets to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the 71st anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The floral baskets were laid before the statues of the great leaders on Sunday.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un Adopted by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Central Africa
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, Sunday received a message of greeting from Faustin Archange Touadera, president and head of state of the Central African Republic.
					 The president in the message extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the happy occasion of celebrating September 9, 2016, the national day of the beautiful DPRK, on behalf of the people and government of Central Africa and on his own behalf.
					
					 The message hoped that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un Adopted by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un Adopted by Koreans in China
Beijing, October 8 (KCNA) -- The Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China held a meeting to adopt a letter to supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the DPRK Embassy in Beijing on Oct. 7 on the occasion of the 71st anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They expressed deep impressions while looking round photos dealing with immortal leadership feats of the great leaders and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Kimchon Citizens in S. Korea Demand Withdrawal of THAAD Deployment Decision
articles.content:
Kimchon Citizens in S. Korea Demand Withdrawal of THAAD Deployment Decision
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- The Kimchon Action Committee against THAAD Deployment in south Korea held a rally in Seoul on October 5 in protest against the puppet authorities' persistent moves to deploy THAAD, according to the south Korean KBS.
					Members of the committee left Kimchon on September 24 and walked to Seoul and attended a rally with more than 1,000 citizens of Kimchon and Ronal Buddhists.
					
					 The participants, holding slogans against THAAD deployment, denounced the authorities for deciding THAAD deployment in Songju Golf Course near Kimchon City.
					
					 They demanded the authorities immediately withdraw the unjustifiable decision and Minister of Defense Han Min Gu resign.
					
					 They conveyed a letter of protest reflecting demand of Kimchon citizens to Chongwadae.

articles.title: Production of Consumer Goods Goes up in DPRK
articles.content:
Production of Consumer Goods Goes up in DPRK
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Factories under the Ministry of Light Industry of the DPRK have increased the production of consumer goods for flood victims in the northern party of the country, in hearty response to the appealing call of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 According to data available at the ministry, over 300 000 pieces of consumer goods like cloth, towel, underwear, socks and shoes were sent to the disaster areas of North Hamgyong Province.

articles.title: Story about Kim Il Sung's Patriotism
articles.content:
Story about Kim Il Sung's Patriotism
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- In every October the Korean people recall a story about fork to Mangyongdae in Pyongyang, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 It was on October 9, Juche 34 (1945) that the President passed the fork to Mangyongdae to visit the then Kangson Steel Plant after Korea's liberation from Japan's colonial rule.
					
					 At the fork, Kim Il Sung asked an official to call at his native home instead and convey his best regards to his grandparents, saying that twenty years has passed since he left his native home at Mangyongdae for the national liberation.
					
					 Ardently requested to drop in even for a moment, he stressed that to build a new country is more urgent than to visit the native home and left for the steel plant to encourage its workers in the efforts to rehabilitate it.
					
					 He visited his birthplace after founding the Workers' Party of Korea and making his first speech on triumphant return at a meeting with the people in homeland.

articles.title: WPK Makes New History of People-first Principle
articles.content:
WPK Makes New History of People-first Principle
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, makes a new history of love for the people by further developing the Workers' Party of Korea into the motherly party as intended by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 It is his steadfast will to dedicate his all and do his best for the people's happiness and wellbeing.
					
					 Thanks to his will and self-sacrificing spirit, Rason in northern tip of the country could turn into a socialist fairyland after being flooded in August last year.
					
					 In September when the unprecedented storm and downpour severely hit North Hamgyong Province, the supreme leader set the recovery in the disaster areas as the spearhead of the ongoing 200-day campaign and took measures to channel all human, material and technical potentials of the country into the recovery efforts. And he has shown all what he could do for the inhabitants in the flood-hit areas, providing them with foods and consumer goods.
					
					 That's why the inhabitants in the disaster areas are unanimous in saying that the WPK and the socialist system in the DPRK are best in the world.
					
					 The WPK led by Kim Jong Un will as ever make a history of people-priority politics.

articles.title: Hospital's Denial of Amendment of Diagnosis Protested by S. Korean Body
articles.content:
Hospital's Denial of Amendment of Diagnosis Protested by S. Korean Body
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- The trade union of the hospital of Seoul National University of south Korea called a press conference on October 6 in protest against the behavior of the hospital side of denying the amendment of diagnosis on death of peasant Paek Nam Gi, according to the south Korean CBS.
					 At the press conference speakers said that the hospital operation camp meddled in cooking up the diagnosis on Paek Nam Gi's death.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Polish Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Polish Organization on Its Website
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was posted by the Polish Branch of the Korean Friendship Association on its website on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of his election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 71st founding anniversary of the WPK.
					 The work, published on October 2, Juche 84 (1995), is a great programme for the party building and activities as it reviews with pride the glorious history of the WPK which hewed out a new path of building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and indicates the road of developing the party into his eternal party.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Venezuela
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Venezuela
Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" was published in booklet by the Venezuelan Lithocopy Publishing House on Sept. 30.
					 The work published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012) clarifies the revolutionary exploits performed by the President and leader Kim Jong Il during their lifetime.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for firmly preserving and glorifying their ideas and exploits.

articles.title: Vocero de cancilleria condena a EE.UU. que difunde el rumor sobre "secuestro de estadounidense por RPDC"
articles.content:
Vocero de cancilleria condena a EE.UU. que difunde el rumor sobre "secuestro de estadounidense por RPDC"
Pyongyang, 9 de octubre (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de un reportero de la ACNC formulada con respecto a que estos dias EE.UU. divulga el rumor de "secuestro de ciudadano norteamericano por parte del Norte de Corea", el vocero del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio la vispera la siguiente respuesta:
					Hace ahora 12 anos, ocurrio un incidente de que el estudiante estadounidense Sneddon fue desaparecido al viajar la zona alpina de otro pais. Al respecto, el pais competente aviso oficialmente al Departamento de Estado  norteamericano y a su familia la posicion de que el ya fuera muerto al caerse en un rio durante su viaje.
					
					Sin embargo, Estados Unidos rumorea actualmente el rumor absurdo arriba mencionado, lo cual no pasa de ser una intriga de la camarilla de Obama, que se halla en un destino miserable por el fracaso total de su politica hostil anti-RPDC, para denigrar la imagen internacional de la RPDC al agrandar al maximo el inexistente "asunto de DDHH".
					
					La RPDC niega y rechaza totalmente la insistencia terca de EE.UU. calificandola de un fraude insignificante.
